attributes.action: Bring Royal Mail back into public ownership
attributes.background: Bringing Royal Mail back into public ownership would protect jobs, employees terms and conditions, pensions and protect a 500 year old legacy that should not be condemned into the history books to make profit for the few off of the backs of the many employees.

attributes.action: Ensure the UK leaves all EU defence rules, policies and structures on 29/03/19.
attributes.background:
Since November 2016, the UK has joined all parts of the EU’s "defence union" except one, without any vote by MPs. These include finance, command centre and a central budget.
If the UK stays in them or if any of them go into an exit agreement, as Govt has proposed, the UK will not have left the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
http://veteransforbritain.uk/brexit-and-defence-integration-a-short-summary/

http://veteransforbritain.uk/the-seven-ways-eu-defence-union-binds-the-uk-in-terms-of-brexit/

http://veteransforbritain.uk/pesco-avoided-but-risks-remain/

http://veteransforbritain.uk/dexeus-defence-partnership-paper-is-a-grave-mistake-and-gives-the-eu-control/

http://veteransforbritain.uk/vfb-chairman-speech/

https://www.brugesgroup.com/blog/the-uk-is-stuck-in-a-quagmire-over-eu-defence-union

attributes.action: Repeal the 1939 Cancer Act so that doctors can offer alternatives to chemo
attributes.background: Doctors are not legally allowed to offer or advise on alternatives for fear of criminal prosecution and the loss of their license to practice.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Historic Vehicles to be processed through scrappage schemes.
attributes.background: Make it illegal for manufacturers to process vehicles which have Historic Vehicle on their V5 documents though any scrappage scheme. A simple way to avoid losing rare road heritage is to make all vehicles with Historic Vehicle on their V5 document, legally exempt from scrappage.
attributes.additional_details: A decision taken by Ford UK to scrap a rare Standard 10 was recently highlighted and reversed. The mint condition classic had been sent for scrap by Ford after it was traded in for a Transit. There are many other examples of historic vehicles being sent for a similar fate. They should have legal protection.

attributes.action: UK Government to ban the sale of electronic training aids for dogs.
attributes.background:
The Scottish and Welsh Governments, using their devolved powers, have already committed to ban the use of electronic shock collars.

The power to ban the sale of these harmful devices lies with the UK Government, which has failed to introduce controls on their use. This must change.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition urges the UK Westminster Government to ban the distribution, sale and use of any electronic training device for dogs, and ensure it is an offence to cause pain or distress to dogs through the use of such devices in England.

This petition also recognises that some specific devices, such as collars which only vibrate, offer potential benefits in certain circumstances such as when dealing with dogs suffering from hearing loss.

attributes.action: The Government must introduce an independent regulator for English football
attributes.background: We urge the Government to introduce an independent regulator for English football, charged with ensuring the highest possible standards of governance for all clubs
attributes.additional_details: Full background information can be found at http://www.blackpoolsupporterstrust.com/Site/LatestNews.aspx?NewId=117

attributes.action: Strip all convicted terrorists with dual nationality of British Citizenship.
attributes.background: A time bomb is ticking away for when convicted terrorists will be released from British prisons onto the streets. Far better to reduce that number instantly by stripping those convicted terrorists with dual citizenship of the British citizenship and the right to bomb again in this United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2017/jul/30/uk-has-stripped-150-jihadists-and-criminals-of-citizenship

attributes.action: Reintroduce Oxford weighting tax.
attributes.background: Unlike London, housing cost is not weighed in when attributing salaries, and the OUH is suffering with recruitment and retaining staff, due to the financial demand of the city.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Kelly (2014), the average house in Oxford costs 14.9 times the city's average salary. 
A large number of OUH staff had to move further away from the city to avoid costs, and face petrol and traveling financial demands.
The remaining staff lives closer to the Hospitals, due to lack of cars, and are struggling to afford rent in the city, where houses do not match the price tag they are given, and many of them are forced to resort to Hospital accommodations, that are far from ideal.

attributes.action: To launch a public inquiry into the failings in the Poppi Worthington case
attributes.background: The family court judge and senior coroner ruled that 13-month-old Poppi Worthington was abused before she died. No one has been charged for her death after officers made mistakes in the investigation. Poppi was unknown to social services before she died, concerning for child protection in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the Prime Minister to order a public inquiry to make recommendations to:
- improve child safeguarding processes 
- strengthen the police disciplinary process 
- determine whether Cumbria Police has truly learnt the lessons of this case
- Examine whether the resources provided to agencies involved in child protection to fulfil their safeguarding responsibilities.

attributes.action: Stop Classic modified vehicles losing their original registration number
attributes.background: I have been a classic car enthusiast for a long time and have built, maintained and modified cars to a very high standard.  I think to lose the vehicle's original registration would be a shame . But I agree that the build quality needs to be kept a check on .

attributes.action: Allow Martial Arts to be on the GCSE/A Level syllabus.
attributes.background: Martial arts such as judo, taekwondo and karate have been dropped from approved activities as part of the GCSE and A Level curriculum. Martial arts promote self discipline, self confidence, respect as well as an excellent way to improve all round fitness and not to mention teaching self defence.

attributes.action: PIP should be administered and decided by the NHS, not the DWP/contracting firms
attributes.background: Currently the DWP handles the deliberation of PIP and ESA. Disability is a state of being dealing with health, not work and pensions. The decisions for any disability related payments or dictates should be handled by the government's experts (i.e. health professionals) in the NHS, not DWP.
attributes.additional_details: In August this year the UN criticised the UK government for its treatment of people with disability and stripping people of their livelihoods, dignity and being.  This has led to an increase of post-decision making unexplained deaths of people with disabilities. The DWP is not concerned with helping people or listening to experts on health related issues with relying on 'for profit' companies making decisions on people with disabilities.  The NHS needs to be the decision making body for PIP.

attributes.action: School staff are worth 5%, children deserve properly funded schools
attributes.background: We think that after years of below inflation pay awards which have cut their living standards, staff in all our schools deserve a 5 percent pay rise.
attributes.additional_details:
With inflation, including housing, running at 3.9 percent this would in reality be a modest 1.1 percent rise in real terms and so a small step towards undoing the much greater cuts school staff have suffered in the last few years.

We also want the government to change its funding plans which at present will mean almost 9 in 10 schools seeing significant cuts which will damage education. Schools should be properly funded, including the cost of a modest rise in school staff pay, so that our children get the education they deserve.

We call on the government to address the linked issues of school funding and school staff pay in its budget plans this autumn.

#Worth5percent

attributes.action: British citizens should be able to appeal the refusal of a family 'visit visa'
attributes.background:
The appeals process for Family Visit Visa was removed on 25 June, 2013 to save costs. My recent personal experience confirmed that the UKBA seem to have cut the process of justice and accountability while cutting their costs. How can this be justified?
Is UKBA now the Judge, Jury and Executioner?
attributes.additional_details:
In response to my query to UKBA I got back a ‘blank’ email with the request to fill out a satisfaction survey! My mother was rejected a visit visa recently and she was told not to apply within next 10 years. She is now 66. Which essentially means she may not possibly visit her grandchildren in UK for the rest of her lifetime. UKBA's rejection has no regards to how it affects me as a British Citizen. Why should UKBA be allowed to impose decisions without due and just care? 
Stop this INJUSTICE!

attributes.action: Introduce super visa category for parents of British citizens similar to Canada
attributes.background: Parents for British citizens  are treated differently if they reside in countries outside the EU and are not EU citizens and government has made the settlement of parents under ADR practically impossible so we are looking for a middle ground as it is done in Canada with SUPER VISA
attributes.additional_details: With the parent and grandparent super visa, eligible parents and grandparents can visit family in Canada for up to two years without the need to renew their status .The Super Visa is a multi-entry visa that provides multiple entries for a period up to 10 years. The key difference is that the Super Visa allows an individual to stay for up to two years on initial entry into Canada, while a 10-year multiple entry visa would only have a status period for each entry of six months only. Refer visa rules by Canada government and criteria as reference ,sponsor does most work

attributes.action: Stop the removal/reduction  of enhanced and unsociable hours pay to NHS staff
attributes.background:
NHS staff are some of the most dedicated and hard working people I've ever known. 
They deserve to have a decent pay award and not have to sacrifice  their enhanced and unsociable hours payment.

attributes.action: Debate in Parliament the lack of an effective policy for the treatment of M.E.
attributes.background: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME) means "muscle pain plus inflammation of the brain/spinal cord", a chronic neurological illness, but "the majority of patients presenting with symptoms of ME in the UK are still referred to psychotherapists for treatment" (Dr Ian Gibson). A policy review is overdue.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS provides psychiatric therapies for what it refers to as "CFS/ME". These therapies are often ineffective and sometimes make patients worse. They are the result of a Myalgic Encephalomyelitis policy heavily influenced by psychiatrists who are skeptical about the existence of Myalgic Encephalomyelitis. It is time for a policy re-think about the effectiveness (and cost-effectiveness) of current treatment.
See: http://www.tymestrust.org (for the effect of current policy on children with ME).

attributes.action: Reform the rules on filibustering - talking excessively to force a bill out
attributes.background:
On several occasions in the past five years, several MPs have spoken for an excessive time during Parliamentary debates. This behaviour prevents reasonable discussion, placing themselves above all other MPs.

This tactic is disgraceful, anti-democratic and has no place in a modern Parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
On multiple occasions, several MPs (most infamously Philip Davies),  have resorted to reading out long lists of topics irrelevant to discussion until presented bills exceeded their allocated discussion time. Details of all instances are present in the Official Report of Parliamentary debates ("Hansard").

This behaviour has prevented several bills, many of which deserved a fair hearing, from being reasonably discussed in Parliament, and places the position of one MP above that of all others.

attributes.action: Stop plans to cut Victoria trains from the Bexleyheath line
attributes.background: The Government has confirmed that all services on the Bexleyheath Line to Victoria will be cut after the new franchise is awarded in 2018, despite the Government’s own consultation showing that 89% of respondents were opposed to plans to cut the number of local rail destinations.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government has ignored their promise that these changes would only be made “if passengers supported it.”

Cutting these services would be a disaster for commuters in areas like Bexleyheath, Welling, Blackheath, Eltham, Kidbrooke and elsewhere who do not have access to the DLR or the Underground, so have to depend on the rail network.  In particular, elderly and disabled passengers, who use the service to access Kings College Hospital at Denmark Hill, will face much more difficult journeys.

attributes.action: To condemn the repression of democracy and freedom of speech in Catalonia
attributes.background: We urge HM Government to make a clear objection to the 'de facto' suspension of Catalan institutions, the detention of democratically elected Catalan politicians & the intimidation towards Catalan media; and to pressure the Spanish Government to enter into dialogue with Catalan institutions.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/sep/20/spain-guardia-civil-raid-catalan-government-hq-referendum-row

attributes.action: Change the law to include both parents’ names in children’s passports.
attributes.background:
600,000 women have been stopped at the border in the past five years to prove they are related to their own child. Women feel vulnerable and it causes delays  - as well as being a burden for border agents.

We must recognise that, increasingly, children will not share their mothers' surnames.
attributes.additional_details:
Women are stopped and have no easy way of proving the relationship without their name being on their child's passport. Changing the law would not only prevent discrimination against women, but also help border staff prevent child trafficking.

1 in 7 women intend not to take their partner’s name - according to recent research by YouGov - while just 4% of women intend to give their child their name instead of the father's.

We need to debate the issue so we can discuss how to rectify the problem.

attributes.action: Proscribe Antifa and other left wing anarchist groups as domestic terrorists
attributes.background:
Groups such as Antifa have publicly boasted that they’re willing to use violence in the name of "social justice". 
In 2017 confidential documents revealed that US Homeland Security officials had classified Antifa as “domestic terrorists”. The UK should and must follow suit.

attributes.action: Make motorcycle awareness part of the theory test
attributes.background: Being a biker I see daily too many people using phones, vapes, headphones etc while driving, Cars pulling out on bikes and tail gating, Just recently a motorcycle rider was killed local to me because a car pulled out on him and he couldnt stop in time, More needs to be done to help bikers be seen.
attributes.additional_details: Maybe this petition will never reach parliament but just by signing and sharing maybe we could reach out and make bikers more aware to drivers.

attributes.action: Video record all PIP, ESA and DLA medical assessments with patient consent
attributes.background: Change the law so that Personal Independence Payment (PIP), Employment Support Allowance (ESA) and Disability Living Allowance (DLA) assessments must be video recorded, if the patient consents, in order for a more accurate outcome honest outcome.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are being refused what they are quite rightly entitled to because many assessments aren't accurate and don't show the needs of each disabled individual, being they are wheelchair bound or mentally ill. Let's change the law in order to get a fair decision. Putting people in physical pain through more pain and the mentally ill questioning why people think they are fine when they are clearly not! Let's help make a difference. Let us the people who live with these illnesses have a voice!

attributes.action: The UK should terminate the EU talks forthwith by withdrawing the Art 50 notice.
attributes.background: It is already clear that, within the current framework, the EU is bound to win.  Article 50 has never been triggered before, and it is manifestly defective in its conceptual structure: the UK should withdraw immediately, and make progress as a Member of the EU, from within.
attributes.additional_details: The current BREXIT negotiations are an irresoluble mess.  The immediate costs of withdrawal will be enormous, and the long-term debilitation of the UK economy even more serious.  Sterling will continue to fall in value, because of all the commercial uncertainty.  The negotiations, instead of constituting a single bargaining process, have been converted, by ill-advised agreement, into a two-stage process, in which the EU has sole control of future progress.  We should seek another way ahead.

attributes.action: Change business rates for child care providers and make them zero VAT rated.
attributes.background: Childcare has recently faced huge increases in business rates for their properties. Coupled with this, they pay VAT on purchases but are unable to reclaim this to offset against the business. Along with increased minimum wage, pensions, and 30 hours funding this is leaving them financially unstable.
attributes.additional_details:
With the onset of the Government scheme to offer 30 hours "free" childcare to parents, the minimum funding leaves the childcare provider liable to make up the shortfall. Increases in business rates & VAT charges are making this unsustainable for childcare providers. Maintained providers are already able to claim taxes paid under Section 33 of the VAT Act 1994. 
The removal of business rates & VAT rating would enable providers to continue to provide the services required without financial burden.

attributes.action: End all local and national public sector service outsourcing
attributes.background: The recent collapse of Carillion has brought attention to the failings of the private sector in delivering vital public services. This petition calls to end all future outsourcing of public service contracts both locally and nationally including councils, health, education and the civil service.
attributes.additional_details: In order for this to be enforced, the petition is calling for legislation ruling such contracts unlawful.

attributes.action: Make BRCA testing a choice for females over 30 on the NHS and more info given
attributes.background: My dearest friend sadly passed away from ovarian cancer but with no family history her doctor misdiagnosed her for 18 months. If more training and information was given to doctors or a BRCA test was done she might of still been here today and lived a life with her husband and little boy
attributes.additional_details:
Stats of ovarian & cervical cancer is shockingly different, according to Cancer Research UK, 7378 ovarian cancer cases in 2016 which lead to 4128 deaths with a survival rate of 34% & cervical cancer 3224 cases in 2016 with 890 deaths with a survival rate of 63%

Due to the fact you are screened every 3 years and doctors are aware of the symptoms for cervical cancer so have a greater change of catching it early, however you are only tested for BRCA if ovarian or breast cancer runs in the family.

attributes.action: Re introduce the MenC vaccine for babies aged 12 weeks of age.
attributes.background: From July 2016, the MenC vaccine for 12 week old babies was discontinued from the NHS childhood vaccination programme.
attributes.additional_details:
In a letter to Public Health England in March 2016 The Joint Committee on Vaccination (JCVI) recommended that infants aged 12 weeks no longer require the vaccination against meningococcal serogroup C (MenC) due to the success of the immunisation programme that started in 1999.
One case is one too many and today there is a baby girl in Bradford fighting for her life after contracting MenC at the age of 10 months.

attributes.action: Keep the category of sex a mandatory question in the 2021 Census.
attributes.background: We oppose the published tentative recommendation by the Office of National Statistics to make sex a non-mandatory field in the 2021 Census. We demand that sex remains a mandatory question in the Census and is included in all government demographic data collection in accordance with SDG5 commitments.
attributes.additional_details: Data collection disaggregated by sex gives us vital information for policy making and distribution of resources.  If implemented, the ONS recommendation will make widely acceptable that sex becomes a voluntary question. This will render useless equal opportunities monitoring designed to combat sex discrimination. It will influence governments worldwide making difficult the monitoring of imbalances resulting from sex-selective abortion, female infanticide and unequal treatment of girls and women.

attributes.action: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis: need more funding for research, awareness, support
attributes.background: Their are 250,000 men, women, children in the UK suffering from ME. While other illnesses get support, sufferers are told it a psychological illness and offered a variety of therapy. But the answers lie with the biomedical scientists, who need more funding to find cause and cure.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter is one of the next generation having to endure this horrific sentence of trying to save as much energy just to try and get through the day so they don't sink further into their world of illness. For many sufferers who are older it may be too late, as half their lives has already been blighted and damaged on this devastating journey - many confined to their beds, a shadow of all their hopes and dreams been ripped away from them, never being able to reach their true potential. We owe it now to give the next generation a chance to find a cure to fulfil their potential and become part of life again. We need the government to listen to our voice and give sufferers the funding, support, respect they desperately need.

attributes.action: After Brexit, EU dialysis provision through EHIC to remain for UK residents.
attributes.background: We urge the Minister for Health to ensure that after Brexit EU dialysis provision through the EHIC reciprocal scheme is preserved for UK residents. Otherwise people on life-saving dialysis in the UK won't be able to travel to Europe any more, unless they can afford to pay for dialysis privately.
attributes.additional_details: Fiona Loud, Policy Director at Kidney Care UK, said “We believe that every kidney patient has the right to live their life to the full and when the time comes to leave the European Union it is vital that they should still be able to travel within Europe. If there is any compromise on the EHIC system then this will effectively mean almost 30,000 people will not be able to travel for business, or take much-needed and well deserved holidays or respite breaks. This is simply not fair and cannot be allowed to happen.”

attributes.action: Ban the terrier men's terriers from trail hunts.
attributes.background: Since the Fox Hunting Ban in 2004, the terrier men are now simply there to lay the trail. The terriers are no longer necessary. Terriers were only used to flush out foxes before the ban.
attributes.additional_details:
The artificial scents that hunts lay should not lead into a badger sett or into a hole in the ground.
In traditional foxhunting the terriermen were used to stop/block fox earths and badger setts in the area where the hunting was to take place to prevent foxes from going to ground. The foxes would be located using terriers, dug out and fox bolted to be hunted again by the hounds. It's hard to imagine which roles terriers could now play in trail hunting and shouldn't be found with trail hunts.

attributes.action: Grant leave to  undocumented Zimbabweans with at least 15years residence in UK
attributes.background: Since  at least 2000,  thousands of Zimbabwean citizens have fled the turbulent political, social and economic situation in Zimbabwe. A  significant number of Zimbabweans with at least 15years residence remain  here undocumented, despite perpetual gross human rights violations in Zimbabwe.
attributes.additional_details: The Zimbabwean government has brought its own citizens to their knees. The situation there is not getting any better. One only has to look at the news reports. Rather than expect a return to a country that is clearly "broken", there is  more humane, compassionate and tolerant action that the UK government can take. Grant leave to remain to undocumented Zimbabweans with at least 15years residence in the UK, further taking into account the best interests of their minor children born here.

attributes.action: Demand For Tougher Action Against Moped Crime
attributes.background: Members of the public are becoming increasingly concerned and frustrated as to how moped crime is being dealt with. We want the government to take action. Moped crime (theft and acts of violence carried out on stolen mopeds) is increasing at an alarming rate. The government must act now
attributes.additional_details:
We the public want the authorities to issue police with greater power and resources in tackling this crimewave. 
Allow the police to pursue these thugs without fear of causing harm or injury to the criminals 
Implement a task force and better resources in dealing with the escalating moped crime
Afford police the time and resources to process evidence handed in by members of the public that would assist in any investigation
To provide secure fixing points for motorcycles and mopeds in the city

attributes.action: To consider the removal of parental responsibility for absent parents.
attributes.background: As a single parent, I believe I should behold the right to make decisions based on the benefit of my child solely as her primary and only care giver.
attributes.additional_details: For example, if an absent father makes the choice to pay no attention their child, I don’t think it's acceptable for any single parent to have to resort to permission from said father regarding decisions the mother wishes to make such as health, schooling and country of residency, if it will work in the best interests of the child.

attributes.action: Build a new A&E Hospital CENTRAL to St Albans, Watford and Dacorum.
attributes.background: We call on the NHS decision makers to instruct West Herts Hospital Trust (WHHT) to amend their Strategic Outline Case to include the most sensible, popular and cost-effective option of building a new A&E hospital in a more accessible and central location than Vicarage Road, Watford.
attributes.additional_details: WHHT have approved plans to redevelop Watford General Hospital as Our A&E Hospital. This is despite the difficulties for many getting to WGH, the sharp gradient of the site, being next-door to a PL football club and the disruption for patients, visitors and staff until it is completed in 2030.A brand new and central West Herts A&E Hospital could be delivered earlier, be less disruptive to hospital services, cost less and provide a better long-term acute care solution for the whole of West Herts.

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details: It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped.

attributes.action: Consultants or GPs to do PIP, DLA and ESA assessments for people with IBD
attributes.background: To get medical assessments conducted by qualified consultants and GPs who understand patients’ conditions in Crohn’s and Ulcerative Colitis, which can give accurate information about their disabilities to support their claims for PIP, DLA and/or ESA.
attributes.additional_details: I suffer from Ulcerative Colitis, ADHD, OCD, Anxiety and Depression Disorder and Cluster 4 which means I can't deal with day to day life. I'm on a drug called Infliximab Infusion which is for my IBD and have to have it every 6-8 weeks in hospital in the Infusion Unit. This suppresses my immune system,  which means I am prone to infections. I have been rejected twice by PIP saying my IBD and Mental Health Issues don't affect me in my day to day life; I am now waiting for a tribunal.

attributes.action: Proscribe Hezbollah as a terrorist organisation in its entirety in the UK
attributes.background: There is a legal loophole in the UK that allows the flag of Hezbollah, an organisation that hates the West, is anti-Semitic and perpetrates international acts of terror, to be flown in Britain because only Hezbollah’s military wing is proscribed by the Government but not its supposed political wing.
attributes.additional_details:
However, even Hezbollah’s own leadership does not differentiate between the two.  Speaking in October 2012, Hezbollah's Deputy Secretary General Naim Qassem stated: "We don't have a military wing and a political one; we don't have Hezbollah on one hand and the resistance party on the other."

This petition calls upon Home Secretary Amber Rudd to once and for all listen to Hezbollah themselves and proscribe Hezbollah as a terrorist organisation in its entirety in the UK.

attributes.action: Endometriosis awareness campaign for women aged between 14-18 in Education
attributes.background: As a sufferer or Endometriosis I strongly believe if I was educated on the signs of Endometriosis I would have pushed for a earlier diagnosis which could effectively prevented mine from becoming so severe that it has taken over my life. I wish to take part in the campaign as i want to help others.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 women suffer with Endometriosis 
There is no cure for Endometriosis 
Endometriosis needs to be bought into education 
Endometriosis causes infertility 
Women are unable to work due to severe Endometriosis 
Women face surgery just months apart because it rapidly grows back

attributes.action: Cancel the smart meter roll-out
attributes.background:
We call on the Government to cancel the smart meter roll-out, on the grounds of:
1) Health-they emit microwave radiation, a Group 2B Carcinogen 
2) Safety-can cause fires 
3) Privacy-consumption data can be tracked/sold 
4) Security-can be hacked 
5) Cost-reports suggest £400+ per household
attributes.additional_details:
Smart Attack
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N29AtA3VodU

Are smart meters to blame for house fires? Mail
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4737864/Are-smart-meter-blame-house-fires.html

...smart meters will cost each household £420 - This Is Money
http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-4846700/Smart-meters-cost-household-420.html

Warning over smart meters privacy risk - BBC
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-18407340

Stop Smart Meters UK
http://stopsmartmeters.org.uk/

attributes.action: Make student paramedics eligible for the NHS learning support fund
attributes.background: The Dept of Health established a fund to provide extra financial support for Healthcare students which excludes paramedics. Student paramedics face similar costs and should not be excluded. Our country is short of paramedics and the exclusion makes it even more challenging to qualify.

attributes.action: UK Government to pass a law requiring Vets to scan all newly registered animals.
attributes.background:
In March this year my British Shorthair Tabby disappeared.  Extensive searches were made contacting all organisations. On targetting Veterinary Surgeries not all were routinely scanning newly registered cats and dogs which was concerning.
I want any suspected thefts to be reported to the Police.
attributes.additional_details: Subsequently another two similar profile cats have disappeared within 0.5miles of my rural community. While these incidents have been reported to local Police their hands are tied and limited with what they can actually do. This loophole allows unscrupulous thieves to identify themselves as the owners thus depriving the true owners of their treasured pets. Kennel Club figures for 2014 show 70,000 animals missing/stolen and Direct Line figures for 2015/16 show cat theft up by 40% and the true numbers of thefts nearer 360,000. Only 10% of cats were retrieved by microchip which in large part is due to the inconsistency of scanning newly registered animals.

attributes.action: Increase the sentence for failure to stop after a fatal road traffic collision
attributes.background: My brother, Andy Lindup, was killed in a hit and run in Dec 2016. By the time the driver was arrested, it was too late to breathalyse him and gather evidence for a charge of dangerous driving for which he could have faced up to 14 years in prison. Instead he got just 6 months for failure to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
The sentence for failing to stop after a fatal road collision must be made equal to the maximum sentence for death by dangerous driving. Otherwise, there is absolutely no incentive for drivers to stop. Why would anyone stop if they knew they could face 14 years as opposed to just 6 months? My family will never know if the driver who killed my brother was under the influence or not. If he wasn’t, maybe he would have stopped if the law was different. If he was, then the law has let him escape justice.
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5168331/Family-man-killed-hit-run-call-law-change.html

attributes.action: Adopt the EU's Anti Tax Avoidance Directive whether we leave or remain in the EU
attributes.background: To stop the UK becoming a tax haven when we leave the EU.  Where the less well off bear a greater share of the tax burden than the very rich and corporations.
attributes.additional_details: One fear is that Brexit is simply so the very rich and corporations can avoid the EU's Anti Tax Avoidance Directive.  They would be able to store their money in the UK and aggressively avoid paying tax. If the UK adopted the EU's Anti Tax Avoidance Directive it would ensure everyone paid tax fairly and give one less reason to object to Brexit

attributes.action: That Parliament should not agree to the UK being part of an EU defence force.
attributes.background: President of the Commission said that the EU is moving to having a single defence force.   To avoid  UK forces being committed to such a military force under EU law, Brexit agreement should contain clear legal drafting that  excludes any such possibility.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-31796337 contains a report on the Presidents' policy by the BBC.   The joint statement between the President and the Prime Minister of 16th October mentions  security co-operation between the UK and the EU in the context of what happens after Brexit.

attributes.action: Don't merge the Parachute Regiment units with the Royal Marines Units.
attributes.background:
We are launching a petition against the proposals to merge the Parachute Regiment units and Royal Marines units.

We must put a stop to the government destroying our Armed Forces.

We do not want the government to merge these units and we do not want any more cuts to be made on our Armed Forces.

attributes.action: Introduce automatic penalties when a contact order is broken repeatedly.
attributes.background: There are many cases documented where one parent repeatedly breaks the Contact Order without penalty and the injured party (normally the father) has to keep going back to Court, at their expense, to try and see their child. This often results in fathers losing contact with their child.
attributes.additional_details: Introducing more stringent automatic penalties when a parent repeatedly breaks a contact order without good reason will help keep parents in their children’s lives. We would also like a named body that can investigate when a contact order is breached. In many European countries, the police intervene immediately to ensure the rights of the child to see their non-resident parent are protected. The existing system is too slow and unwieldy and the penalties are unenforceable.

attributes.action: Publicly reinforce the UK Government's commitment to preserving Net Neutrality.
attributes.background: Given the recent worrying proposals by the US Federal Communications Commission, now more than ever our government must make an early commitment to maintaining a British equivalent to the EU's 'Regulation on Open Internet Access' as part of the Great Repeal Bill during the Brexit transition.
